items.title: Alami to shed 40% of workforce amid strategy shift
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Alami, a Shariah-compliant fintech firm in Indonesia, is laying off 40% of its workforce for sustainable growth.
- Primarily affecting research, product, and engineering teams; cuts to be implemented on February 21, 2025.
- Alami has disbursed $374 million, with 11,743 active lenders and 2,101 borrowers on its platform.
- The company focuses on long-term profitability, expecting its P2P lending business to break even soon after the layoffs.

items.title: Tencent restructures consumer AI product line with key team shifts
items.summary:
- Tencent has reorganized its AI-focused consumer applications, including QQ Browser, Sogou Input, and ima.copilot, moving them to the Cloud and Smart Industries Group (CSIG).
- This restructuring aims to enhance resource allocation and integrate AI across Tencent’s products.
- As of January 2025, QQ Browser has over 430 million monthly active users; ima.copilot is an AI productivity tool launched in October 2024.
- These changes support Tencent’s strategy to improve its AI ecosystem and cloud infrastructure for enterprise clients.

items.title: Chinese 3D printing startup Second Life closes Series A for global expansion
items.summary:
- Second Life raised nearly US$10 million in Series A funding.
- The funding round was led by Nano Labs, with participation from Daocin Capital.
- Founded in 2013, the company specializes in 3D scanning technology for creating customized figures and digital avatars.
- The funds will enhance their 3D printing technologies and support global expansion and cloud platform development.

items.title: Raining on India’s IPO parade
items.summary:
- Indian IPO market experiencing a slowdown.
- Several companies have postponed or canceled their IPOs due to adverse market conditions.
- Regulatory challenges and economic uncertainties are factors affecting the market's performance.

items.title: Ant Group opens new hires for humanoid robots
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- Ant Group is recruiting new staff focused on humanoid robotics.
- The roles aim to enhance the company's technology in robotics and automation.
- This initiative indicates a strategic shift towards integrating humanoid robots in their operations.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Indonesia’s startups
items.summary:
- The article focuses on actively investing firms in Indonesia’s startup scene over the past two years.
- Only firms that have invested in three or more companies within this timeframe are featured.
- Efforts are ongoing to provide a more comprehensive view of the impact of each investor.

items.title: Swiggy shares jump 7%, market cap hits $10.1b
items.summary:
- Swiggy shares increased by nearly 7% to 370.90 rupees ($4.46) on Feb. 19 during intraday trading on BSE.
- Market capitalization rose to 83,576 crore rupees ($10.1 billion).
- Over 1 crore (10 million) shares traded by the time of reporting.
- Broader market: Sensex gained 0.068% to 76,018.91; Nifty dropped 0.020% to 22,940.65 as of 11:11 AM.

items.title: TikTok users surpass Facebook in S Korea over privacy issues
items.summary:
- TikTok's user base in South Korea has grown significantly, reaching 4.89 million monthly active users in January 2025.
- TikTok Lite, its lightweight version, added another 4.79 million users.
- Combined, TikTok’s users totaled 9.69 million, exceeding Facebook's 8.61 million users.
- TikTok Lite was launched in late 2023 to accommodate users with limited device capabilities.
- This growth occurs amid concerns regarding data privacy and app addiction, with South Korean authorities suspending new downloads of the DeepSeek chatbot due to data-sharing issues with ByteDance.

items.title: Indian deeptech startup Probus raises $5m series A1
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Probus Smart Things raised US$5 million in series A1 funding, led by Unicorn India Ventures.
- Total funding for Probus now exceeds US$8 million.
- Funds will be used to enhance communication technology for smart grids and renewable energy, plus integrate AI into networking.
- Probus provides hardware and software solutions for utility providers focusing on energy management, grid analytics, and automation.
- Their smart metering solutions utilize cellular and bluetooth technologies across several Indian states.
- Since 2023, Probus experienced a tenfold revenue increase, tripled its workforce, and obtained new patents.
- Key partners include Adani Power, Tata Power, and Torrent Power.

items.title: China’s EV industry leads global rivals, BYD CEO says
items.summary:
- BYD’s CEO claims that China's electric vehicle (EV) industry is ahead of global competitors.
- The statement reflects the rapid growth and innovation in China's EV market.
- BYD aims to further expand its influence in the international EV sector.

items.title: Israeli blockchain security firm raises $50m series B
items.author: Ido Ben-Natan, Raz Niv
items.summary:
- Blockaid raised US$50 million in a series B funding round led by Ribbit Capital.
- The total capital raised now amounts to US$83 million after a previous series A round of US$27 million in October 2023.
- Founded in 2022, Blockaid focuses on securing blockchain transactions, having scanned over 2.4 billion transactions and protecting assets worth over US$101 billion.

items.title: Pokémon Go maker Niantic in $3.5b sale talks with Scopely
items.summary:
- Niantic Inc. is negotiating the sale of its video game business to Scopely Inc.
- The potential deal is valued at approximately US$3.5 billion.
- The agreement may include Pokémon Go and other Niantic mobile games.
- No confirmation of a finalized deal; both companies have declined to comment.
- Niantic became prominent with the launch of Pokémon Go in 2016.

items.title: Japan chip materials maker to pursue deals after debt cut
items.author: Hidehito Takahashi
items.summary:
- Resonac Holdings plans to pursue new deals after debt reduction.
- CEO Hidehito Takahashi is interested in the state-backed fund's exit from JSR.
- Resonac is investing in a research and development center in Silicon Valley for semiconductor collaborations.
- Future US production of materials depends on subsidies, tariffs, and customer demand.
- JSR is focusing on industry consolidation post-privatization.

items.title: Chinese robotaxi firm WeRide stock soars 40%, valued at $11b
items.summary:
- WeRide’s stock surged nearly 40% on Feb. 18, closing above US$40, with a market value exceeding US$11 billion.
- On Feb. 16, shares rose 140% intraday, resulting in an 83.46% gain and doubling the market value in two days.
- The surge in investor interest followed the news that Nvidia owns US$1.74 million of WeRide’s American Depositary Shares, valued at US$24.65 million as of December 2024.
- WeRide has partnered with Nvidia since 2017 for autonomous driving technology.
- Recent developments:  
  - Jan 15, 2025: Launched autonomous vehicles in Switzerland; plans to expand to eight vehicles by 2026.  
  - Dec 6, 2024: Uber and WeRide launched a robotaxi service in Abu Dhabi, aiming for fully driverless vehicles by 2025.  
  - Oct 28, 2024: Raised $440.5M in IPO, valuing the firm at $5.2B; shares increased by 21% post-IPO.  
  - Dec 12, 2023: Obtained licenses for autonomous driving testing in Singapore, becoming the first to hold self-driving permits in four countries.  
  - Aug 30, 2023: Received US IPO approval from the China SEC under new rules.  
  - Jul 5, 2023: Secured UAE’s first self-driving vehicle license for public testing.

items.title: Blizzard president visits China as Overwatch returns
items.author: Johanna Faries
items.summary:
- Blizzard President Johanna Faries visited China to mark her one-year milestone in office.
- The trip includes meetings with the Blizzard China team in Shanghai and visits to NetEase teams in Hangzhou.
- Overwatch officially returns to China on February 19, as part of a renewed collaboration.

items.title: US SEC seeks India’s help in Adani’s $265m bribery case
items.summary:
- The US SEC is investigating Gautam Adani and his nephew Sagar Adani for a $265 million bribery scheme.
- The SEC filed a complaint in a New York district court on February 18, 2025.
- The SEC has reached out to India's ministry of law and justice to serve the complaint to the Adanis, who are in India.

items.title: Israel’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- Israel recognized as a “startup nation” with significant growth in its high-tech sector since the early 2000s.
- The article features an automated tracker showing the companies that have attracted the most funding in the past decade.
- Additional coverage on top-funded tech companies in other regions is linked for reader reference.

items.title: Hong Kong explores crypto products to lead in digital assets
items.summary:
- Hong Kong is exploring new cryptocurrency products, including derivatives and margin lending, targeting select investors.
- CEO of the Securities and Futures Commission (SFC), Julia Leung, announced these plans at the Coindesk Consensus Hong Kong 2025 conference.
- The initiative aims to position Hong Kong as a leader in digital assets, with nine digital asset trading licenses already issued and eight more applications under review.
- The government is also working on regulations for stablecoins to enhance its status as a virtual asset hub, especially after China's 2021 ban on crypto transactions.

items.title: Musk’s X in talks to raise funding at $44b valuation
items.summary:
- X, formerly known as Twitter, is in discussions to raise funding at a valuation of $44 billion, the same price Elon Musk paid in 2022.
- This is X's first fundraising attempt since it went private.
- Ongoing talks could still be canceled, with no official confirmation on details.
- Musk's AI company xAI is also seeking investors for a projected valuation of $75 billion.

items.title: Taiwan’s ASE launches $300m chip plant in Malaysia
items.summary:
- ASE Technology Holding has opened a US$300 million semiconductor plant in Penang, Malaysia.
- This facility is ASE's fifth in Malaysia and is part of a strategy to diversify supply chains beyond Taiwan.
- The expansion increases ASE's total floor space in Malaysia to 315,870 square meters.
- The new plant will primarily produce image sensors for industrial applications, including humanoid robots.
- Existing plants in Malaysia focus on image sensors and power management chips for vehicles and industrial devices.

items.title: Shenzhen leads AI-driven governance with DeepSeek model
items.summary:
- Shenzhen deploys 70 AI-powered civil servants in Futian District for enhanced government services.
- Digital employees support 240 business scenarios, improving document correction accuracy to over 95%.
- Review times reduced by 90% thanks to the new AI model, DeepSeek R1, which operates with a dedicated team 24/7.
- Recent innovations include expanding DeepSeek's capabilities and monetization efforts, with notable updates on Feb 18, Feb 17, and more in February 2025.

items.title: Gogoro, Castrol team up for Vietnam’s electric scooters
items.summary:
- Gogoro Inc. has partnered with Castrol Holdings to target Vietnam's electric scooter market.
- The collaboration will utilize Castrol’s regional expertise for Gogoro’s market entry.
- Gogoro will manage scooter design and battery technology, whereas Castrol will oversee operations.
- Vietnam, which sells three million two-wheelers annually, is Gogoro's first Southeast Asian market entry.

items.title: India boosts EV push with 9,800 e-buses across two cities
items.summary:
- The Indian Ministry of Heavy Industries approved subsidies for 9,800 electric buses in Bengaluru (7,000) and Hyderabad (2,800) as part of the PM E-Drive scheme.
- This initiative covers 70% of the goal to support 14,028 e-buses across nine metro cities by 2026.
- Other cities included are Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, Chennai, Ahmedabad, Surat, and Pune.
- The PM E-Drive scheme launched in September 2024, replacing the FAME scheme to enhance EV adoption in India.
- The two-year budget for the program is 10,900 crore rupees (US$1.3 million), which includes subsidies for various vehicles including two-wheelers and ambulances.

items.title: TikTok Shop expands to Europe, Japan, Brazil
items.summary:
- TikTok Shop is launching in Europe, Japan, and Brazil.
- The expansion aims to capitalize on the rising popularity of social commerce in these regions.
- TikTok Shop integrates shopping features directly within the TikTok app to enhance user experience.

items.title: South Korea accuses DeepSeek of data sharing with ByteDance
items.summary:
- South Korea’s Personal Information Protection Commission (PIPC) accused DeepSeek of sharing user data with ByteDance, TikTok’s parent company.
- Evidence of communication was cited, but specific data transferred was not disclosed.
- DeepSeek has been removed from Apple and Google’s app stores in South Korea but remains accessible via web browsers.
- The PIPC criticized DeepSeek for lack of transparency and non-compliance with privacy laws, warning against entering personal information into the app.
- Cybersecurity firm Security Scorecard alleged integration between DeepSeek and ByteDance, suggesting data may have been transmitted to ByteDance servers linked to Chinese state entities.
- DeepSeek is cooperating with the ongoing investigation.

items.title: IPhone parts maker Murata plans expansion in India
items.author: Norio Nakajima
items.summary:
- Murata Manufacturing Co. is considering shifting some production capacity to India due to increasing demand in the region.
- The move aligns with an ongoing supply chain realignment.
- Murata’s capacitors are used in devices from major companies including Apple, Samsung, Nvidia, and Sony, as well as for NASA's Mars helicopter.

items.title: Australia’s Goodman to raise $2.54b for data center
items.summary:
- Goodman Group aims to raise A$4 billion (US$2.54 billion) for data center and logistics expansion, as well as debt reduction.
- Share placement will involve issuing 119.42 million shares at a price of A$33.5 (US$21.91) each.
- A security purchase plan of A$400 million (US$250 million) will be offered to existing investors.
- Currently operating 5 gigawatts of data centers across 13 cities, plans to add 0.5 gigawatts by June 2025.

items.title: Tesla expands to India with new showrooms, hiring
items.summary:
- Tesla opens new showrooms in Delhi’s Aerocity and Mumbai’s Bandra Kurla Complex.
- The 5,000-square-foot showrooms will offer imported EVs; no service centers will be included.
- Tesla begins hiring in India, listing 13 job openings primarily in Mumbai.
- Tesla's entry follows a meeting between Elon Musk and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, focusing on technology and innovation.
- High import duties have delayed Tesla’s entry into the Indian market, though a new government policy announced in March 2024 aims to reduce these duties for local production.

items.title: Google AI workers illegally silenced on pay, union says
items.summary:
- The Alphabet Workers Union (AWU) filed a complaint with the NLRB on Feb. 19 regarding wage restrictions imposed by Hitachi through GlobalLogic.
- GlobalLogic manages about 1,800 employees working on Google’s AI products, allegedly limiting wage discussions and firing an employee for raising concerns.
- Google stated that GlobalLogic employees are under Hitachi, not Alphabet, and that it expects fair treatment from its suppliers.

items.title: Apple removes EU apps missing trader info under digital law
items.summary:
• Apple revised App Store policies on Feb. 18 to comply with Digital Services Act (DSA).
• DSA requires app developers to disclose trader details, affecting revenue-generating apps.
• 135,000 apps became inactive within 30 hours due to noncompliance, impacting small developers.
• Trader information is now displayed below app details in the EU App Store.
• Removed apps must provide verified trader details for reinstatement, heavily affecting independent developers.

items.title: Google launches direct e-book, audiobook sales on iOS
items.summary:
- Google has received approval to sell e-books and audiobooks directly through the iOS version of its Google Play Books app.
- Users can click a “Get book” button to complete purchases on the Google Play website, bypassing Apple's 30% commission on in-app purchases.
- This change follows Apple's external link account entitlement allowing “reader apps” to direct users to external purchases.

items.title: As eFishery flounders, aquatech firms refuse to sink
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Investor interest in Surabaya-based [Crustea](https://www.crustea.id/) surged in 2023 amid eFishery's valuation rise.
- eFishery’s alleged fraud is causing skepticism towards tech startups in the aquatech sector.
- Agritech founders, like [Roikhanatun Nafi’ah](https://www.linkedin.com/in/rnafiah/), must differentiate their businesses from the troubles faced by eFishery.
- Experts believe eFishery’s issues don't reflect the entire aquatech sector.
- Indonesia's long coastline provides opportunities for marine product exports, with a current market of [US$4.8 billion](https://www.liputan6.com/bisnis/read/5837573/ekspor-perikanan-indonesia-tembus-rp-77-triliun-di-2024-paling-banyak-ke-negara-ini) in 2024, still lagging behind China.

items.title: HP acquires AI wearable startup Humane for $116m
items.author: Imran Chaudhri, Bethany Bongiorno
items.summary:
- HP Inc. is acquiring assets from Humane Inc. for $116 million.
- The deal includes most employees, intellectual property, and software, excluding AI Pin hardware.
- Founders Imran Chaudhri and Bethany Bongiorno will lead a new AI-focused division at HP.
- Expected deal closure by the end of February.
- Humane faced market struggles, despite over $230 million raised, and quality issues.
- In 2024, the company pivoted to software with the AI operating system Cosmos for HP integration.
- Humane sought buyers since May 2024, initially targeting $750 million to $1 billion valuation.

items.title: Ex-OpenAI CTO Murati launches human-AI collaboration lab
items.author: Mira Murati, John Schulman, Barret Zoph, Lilian Weng
items.summary:
- Mira Murati, former CTO of OpenAI, has launched Thinking Machines Lab with over 30 employees, including many ex-OpenAI staff.
- The lab focuses on AI models for human-AI collaboration, emphasizing science and programming applications.
- The startup aims to create AI systems that work alongside humans and plans to share research through various platforms.
- Currently seeking venture capital funding, but it has not disclosed financial details.
- Murati was involved in major OpenAI releases like ChatGPT and left the company in late 2023.

items.title: Chinese robotaxi firm CEO becomes billionaire as stock soars
items.summary:
- James Peng, CEO of Pony.ai, became a billionaire as the company's stock jumped 41% since its Nasdaq IPO.  
- His 17% stake is now valued at US$1.1 billion according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.  
- The stock rise is part of a larger rally in Chinese tech stocks, aided by renewed government support.  
- Pony.ai operates 250 robotaxis across several cities and has expanded into South Korea, Singapore, and the Middle East.

items.title: Intel stock jumps 16% on potential breakup rumor
items.summary:
- Intel Corp.'s stock rose 16% to US$27.39 on Feb. 18 due to breakup rumors involving TSMC and Broadcom.
- This increase marks Intel's largest single-day gain since March 2020.
- Intel has struggled in recent years, falling behind competitors and missing AI advancements.

items.title: Mistral introduces new AI model for Middle East, South Asia
items.summary:
- Mistral AI has launched Mistral Saba, a 24-billion-parameter language model for the Middle East and South Asia.
- The model supports Arabic and various Indian languages, including Tamil, and delivers responses at speeds over 150 tokens per second.
- Mistral Saba is available via API and can be deployed locally for enhanced security, targeting applications in conversational AI, finance, healthcare, and education.

items.title: Indonesian gov’t plans to create local version of DeepSeek
items.summary:
- The Indonesian government is developing an AI model inspired by the open-source AI DeepSeek.
- Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, Chairman of the National Economic Council, announced the plan to present it to the President within two weeks.
- The AI will support both English and Indonesian, aligning with the country's digitalization objectives.
- A team of young Indonesian developers is involved in this project.
- Specific technical details of the model are yet to be released.

items.title: OpenAI launches new benchmark to test AI in freelance work
items.author: null
items.summary:
- OpenAI has introduced a new benchmark aimed at evaluating AI performance in freelance job scenarios.
- The benchmark is designed to help developers create and fine-tune AI tools specifically for freelancers.
- This initiative reflects the growing importance of AI in transforming freelance work and enhancing productivity for independent workers.

items.title: Bumble sees user decline, revenue drop as shares fall 11%
items.summary:
- Bumble Inc. projects first-quarter revenue between US$242 million and US$248 million, below expectations.
- Shares declined by 11% following this forecast during extended trading on Feb. 19.
- The company reported a 4.4% decrease in fourth-quarter revenue, totaling US$261.6 million.
- Paying users for the Bumble app fell to 2.8 million, down by 57,000 from the previous quarter.
- The decline in users coincides with reduced engagement and spending across online dating platforms.

items.title: Amazon, Microsoft lead task force on carbon market reforms
items.summary:
- Amazon and Microsoft are leading a new task force aimed at reforming carbon markets.
- The task force includes various stakeholders to enhance transparency and efficiency in carbon trading.
- The initiative is part of broader efforts to tackle climate change by improving the integrity of carbon offset programs.

items.title: Singtel’s Q3 profit up 22% driven by Optus, Airtel
items.summary:
- SingTel reported a 22% increase in underlying net profit for Q3 ending Dec. 31, 2024.
- Growth driven by improved performance from Optus and Bharti Airtel.
- Revenue from Optus rose by 3% to S$1.86 billion (US$1.39 billion).
- Bharti Airtel saw nearly sixfold increase in consolidated net profit for the quarter.

items.title: Baidu’s Q4 revenue falls 2% as ad dip offsets AI cloud gains
items.summary:
- Baidu's Q4 revenue for 2024 was 34.12 billion yuan (US$4.7 billion), a 2% year-on-year decline.
- Despite the decline, revenue slightly exceeded analyst expectations of 33.32 billion yuan (US$4.61 billion).
- Online marketing revenues decreased by 7% to 17.9 billion yuan (US$2.48 billion) due to economic pressures in China.
- The Cloud AI business saw a 26% increase, reaching 7.1 billion yuan (US$983 million), driven by rising demand for AI solutions.

items.title: Uber launches 0% commission model for India’s auto drivers
items.summary:
- Uber introduces a 0% commission model for auto drivers in India, effective Feb. 18.
- The platform will connect riders with drivers without managing rides.
- Fares are negotiated directly between driver and rider.
- Uber will not be liable for ride cancellations or service refusals.
- This model follows a trial in six cities and is influenced by Rapido's similar subscription model.

items.title: Standard Chartered sees more sovereign funds buying bitcoin
items.summary:
- Standard Chartered's Geoffrey Kendrick anticipates increased bitcoin purchases by sovereign wealth funds.
- Abu Dhabi's sovereign wealth fund revealed a 4,700 BTC stake in BlackRock's bitcoin ETF.
- Q4 SEC filings indicate growing interest in bitcoin from institutional investors, especially hedge funds.
- Bitcoin investment interest has shifted from retail to hedge funds and now to sovereign funds.
- Future involvement from state pension funds and central banks is expected, with potential interest from groups like the State of Wisconsin Investment Board.
- Standard Chartered forecasts bitcoin reaching US$500,000 by 2028, driven by better institutional access and lower volatility.

items.title: SG contributed less than 1% of Nvidia’s revenue: minister
items.author: Tan See Leng
items.summary:
- Singapore contributes less than 1% of Nvidia's revenue for the period ending October 2024.
- Tan See Leng clarified to lawmakers on Feb. 18 that invoices through Singapore represent centralized billing, not actual product delivery.
- The US is investigating whether the Chinese AI startup DeepSeek acquired Nvidia chips via third parties in Singapore, bypassing export controls.
- Nvidia asserts that it does not believe DeepSeek violated export restrictions, and Singapore customs is cooperating with the inquiry.

items.title: China plans to boost energy storage for AI, carbon goals
items.summary:
- China has announced a plan to enhance its energy storage sector to support rising power demands, particularly from AI industries.
- The initiative, led by eight government departments, aims for the development of next-generation battery technologies.
- By 2027, the goal is to establish three to five key energy storage enterprises, improving renewable energy efficiency and reducing fossil fuel dependency.
- This plan is essential for achieving China's carbon goals of peaking emissions by 2030 and reaching carbon neutrality by 2060.
- The initiative will also bolster China’s global competitiveness and energy independence, according to economist Liang Yan.
- Proposed storage solutions are expected to stabilize the grid during the transition to cleaner energy.

items.title: Israeli bio-insecticide startup secures $6.1m series A
items.author: Amir Ayali, Rony Oren Benaroya
items.summary:
- Ibi Ag, an Israel-based crop protection company, secured US$6.1 million in series A funding, led by Corteva, Inc.
- Other investors include The Trendlines Group, Iron Nation, and Consensus Business Group, along with support from the Israel Innovation Authority.
- The startup develops bio-insecticides using single-domain antibody technology, targeting pests while minimizing ecological impact and harm to non-target organisms.
- Initially focusing on high-value crops, Ibi Ag plans to expand its products to row crops.

items.title: Israeli VC firm closes $400m third fund, AUM hits $1b
items.summary:
[Israeli venture capital firm raised $400 million for its third fund.]
[Total assets under management (AUM) now reach $1 billion.]
[The fund will focus on investments in the tech sector.]

items.title: ByteDance names ex-Google exec as AI research head
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- ByteDance appoints Wu Yonghui to lead foundational research on AI.
- Wu previously worked at Google for 17 years, including roles at Google Brain and DeepMind.
- He will oversee research within ByteDance's Seed department, established in early 2023, focused on large language models and generative AI.
